reviewText: This is a cute DVD.  For the price, you get 8 or 9 cartoons.  Regardless of how many times I have seen these, they are always funny.  It will keep a child occupied for an hour.  This makes a great birthday or get well present.  I am only giving this DVD 4 stars because I had hoped to see more cartoons with Chip and Dale by themselves.  Still, the cartoons included with this DVD are funny, especially when Chip and Dale are with Donald Duck.
summary: Them crazy chipmunks are at it again!!!

reviewText: How can a DVD be "great" and only merit three stars? Simple - while the actual content is genuine gold, the presentation and selection of that content is highly questionable.  Each short on this disc is fantastic, doubly so if you're a Chip n' Dale fan, as I am.  You'll be laughing for the entire sixty minutes at a great set of cartoons that show what made Disney so great.  I don't give the cartoons themselves three stars, indeed the cartoons are deserving of five stars.Unfortunately the package itself leads to some serious questioning.  To begin, none of the cartoons appear to have been restored - the transfers are particularly shoddy.  Compared to the Disney Treasures sets, the cartoons on this disc look very dark and dull - this is very unfortunate as it does little justice to the incredible talents of the Disney production studio.  Having compared a few of the shorts that are included on this set to their counterparts on The Chronological Donald Volume 3, I can say that I am very disappointed.Secondly, like other reviewers here on Amazon, I question the selection of cartoons for the disc.  While there are some very funny cartoons on the disc, I would have loved to see The Lone Chipmunk, a short that is likely not to appear on the Disney Treasures sets.  At least the set does include Chicken in the Rough (a fantastic short) and Two Chips and a Miss, both solo outings.  Most of the shorts will showcase what made Chip n' Dale such great antagonists for the ever irascible (and ever hilarious) Donald Duck.The DVD is saved, perhaps, by its low price.  At $9.99 USD this DVD is a real bargain.  While I regret that the presentation is of very low quality, the simple fact is that the disc has sixty minutes of hilarious cartoons is well worth the entry fee.  I would gladly play three times the cost of this disc for restored shorts and some special features.  The other DVDs in the Classic Cartoon Favorites series might be worth missing out but this disc makes for a fantastic companion piece to the Disney Treasures discs, in particular because a lot of the content has yet to see release on those sets.Do check your Disney Treasures sets against the cartoon list on this DVD as you'll prefer the transfers on those sets more then this disc but if you're just looking for some Chip n' Dale cartoons without being a serious collector then this disc is a real bargain - great for kids young and old.  Thus, despite what would be regarded as some major flaws by serious collectors, I can still heartily recommend this very funny DVD.
summary: A great DVD with a few problems

reviewText: This would have been a five star release if not for:1) it is too short and2) It has only two of their three solo cartoons. "LONE CHIPMUNKS" is missing and SHOULD have been included.  It is unlikely that Chip & Dale will get their own Disney Treasures DVD release with only three cartoons.Unlike most of the Cartoon Favorites series DVDs, this installment mostly features cartoons not yet available on the Disney Treasures series.  The descriptions are already included above, so I will give the duplication run down here:CHIP AND DALE (1947)- NEW TO DVD but expected to be on the Disney Treasures: Chronological Donald volume 3 to be released this Dec. 11 2007.TREE FOR BREAKFAST (1948) - NEW TO DVD but expected to be on the Disney Treasures: Chronological Donald volume 3 to be released this Dec. 11 2007.OUT ON A LIMB (1950) - NEW TO DVD but expected to be on the Disney Treasures: Chronological Donald volume 3 to be released this Dec. 11 2007.FOOD FOR FEUDIN' (1950) - Only cartoon already released on "Disney Treasures: Complete Pluto volume 2".OUT OF SCALE (1951) - NEW TO DVD, not yet announced for any Donald Duck release.CHICKEN IN THE ROUGH (1951) - NEW TO DVD - solo Chip & Dale cartoon.TWO CHIPS AND A MISS (1952) - NEW TO DVD - solo Chip & Dale cartoon.WORKING FOR PEANUTS (1953) - NEW TO DVD, not yet announced for any Donald Duck release.DRAGON AROUND (1954) - NEW TO DVD, not yet announced for any Donald Duck release.Bottom line: This is a MUST GET DVD!
summary: Very good, but should have twice as many cartoons.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm Soooo glad Disney Finally put some of Chip & Dale's classic shorts on DVD!!  It got kinda old waiting for them to come bit by bit on the complete Mickey, Donald & Pluto Disney Treasures or House of Mouse Christmas DVD - plus it left no hope for C&D; only cartoons.  This solves that problem!Overall the DVD's not bad. I thought it was interesting that the menus have the C&D; that are back to back w/ one leg in the air (often used in Japan & also has the coloring like in Japan). The cover for this DVD is surprisingly similar yet different from the VHS "Nuts about Chip & Dale" (Dale now holds the flowers not Chip).No extra features *sniff* . Has previews.also has closed captioning subtitles. It's interesting to notice how in the early cartoons they recycled C&D;'s dialogue ("wow that's a big nut!" when no where near a nut for example). While it's nice to finally get what they're chattering about, it's also not always accurate. Especially on "Dragon Around". They even got Donald's dialogue wrong on that one.  But it's great to see it when it's accurate!They didn't digitally re-master it, they just digitized it. But considering this might be the last time we see the original specks of dust & film grain (since most of 'em willl start showing up on Pluto & Donald vol 2 Disney Treasures), it's kinda nice. There's something going on in the top right corner of the last few cartoons on the disc that's weird... I wonder what got on the film! Anyway...It has Disney FastPlay on it which makes it run like a VHS tape w/o worrying about the menus which is nice - especially when they still let you skip through the previews when you use it!Overall not bad - it's what I expected.  Since I collect Chip & Dale I'll take whatever Disney gives & accept it joyfully.  But that being said, I heard UK DVDs have a vol. 2 which I wish was available in the US so we can see EVERY chip & dale cartoon made (maybe even their cameo in Mickey's Christmas carol!), & I'm still hoping for Chip & Dale Rescue Rangers in season DVD sets...If you're a Chip & Dale fan - Buy this!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's about time an affordable series of Disney cartoons was released.  I know they've had some truly stellar gift sets, box sets, metallic box sets, etc, and those are GREAT.  But not everyone can afford an investment of that sort.  When my 17 year old son was about 4, we used to enjoy the heck out of Chip `n' Dale cartoons.  Disney had a couple of video tapes dedicated to them, each with somewhere around 5 cartoons.  They were less than $10 and believe me, we nearly wore those suckers out.  Since the advent of DVD, we haven't had such an affordable little collection.Now comes this new series, and I immediately had to snatch up the Chip `n' Dale collection.  We get just under an hour of entertainment...a cross section of Chip `n' Dale's history.  Although I don't have young kids anymore, the whole family enjoyed a little trip down memory lane with these undeniably funny characters.  All the episodes where the two chipmunks torment poor Donald Duck are just hilarious.I highly recommend this affordable romp!
